get.description: Get the certificates in the specified certificate store

parameters.name: store
parameters.description: The store to enumerate

200.description: The operation was successful.

patch.description: Add a certificate to the specified store. The certificate is provided as a pfx/pkcs12 optionally password protected blob.

parameters.name: store
parameters.description: The store to add the certificate to

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The optional password of the pfx

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The pfx encoded certificate.

200.description: The operation was successful.

get.description: Get the certificates in the specified certificated store

parameters.name: store
parameters.description: The store to enumerate

200.description: The operation was successful.

patch.description: Add a certificate revocation list to the specified store. The certificate revocation list is provided as a der encoded blob.

parameters.name: store
parameters.description: The store to add the certificate to

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The pfx encoded certificate.

200.description: The operation was successful.

delete.description: Remove a certificate revocation list from the specified store.

parameters.name: store
parameters.description: The store to add the certificate to

200.description: The operation was successful.

post.description: Add a certificate chain to the specified store. The certificate is provided as a concatenated asn encoded set of certificates with the first the one to add, and the remainder the issuer chain.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The certificate chain.

200.description: The operation was successful.

post.description: Move a rejected certificate from the rejected folder to the trusted folder on the publisher.

parameters.name: thumbprint
parameters.description: The thumbprint of the certificate to trust.

200.description: The operation was successful.

post.description: Add a certificate chain to the trusted https store. The certificate is provided as a concatenated set of certificates with the first the one to add, and the remainder the issuer chain.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The certificate chain.

200.description: The operation was successful.

delete.description: Remove a certificate with the provided thumbprint from the specified store.

parameters.name: store
parameters.description: The store to add the certificate to

parameters.name: thumbprint
parameters.description: The thumbprint of the certificate to delete.

200.description: The operation was successful.

delete.description: Remove all certificates and revocation lists from the specified store.

parameters.name: store
parameters.description: The store to add the certificate to

200.description: The operation was successful.

post.description: Start publishing values from a node on a server. The group field in the Connection Model can be used to specify a writer group identifier that will be used in the configuration entry that is created from it inside OPC Publisher.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The server and node to publish.

200.description: The operation was successful.

post.description: Stop publishing values from a node on the specified server. The group field that was used in the Connection Model to start publishing must also be specified in this connection model.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The node to stop publishing

200.description: The operation was successful.

post.description: Configure node values to publish and unpublish in bulk. The group field in the Connection Model can be used to specify a writer group identifier that will be used in the configuration entry that is created from it inside OPC Publisher.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The nodes to publish or unpublish.

200.description: The operation was successful.

post.description: Get all published nodes for a server endpoint. The group field that was used in the Connection Model to start publishing must also be specified in this connection model.

200.description: The items were found and returned.

post.description: PublishNodes enables a client to add a set of nodes to be published. Further information is provided in the OPC Publisher documentation.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The request contains the nodes to publish.

200.description: The operation was successful.

post.description: UnpublishNodes method enables a client to remove nodes from a previously configured DataSetWriter. Further information is provided in the OPC Publisher documentation.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The request payload specifying the nodes to unpublish.

200.description: The operation was successful.

post.description: Unpublish all specified nodes or all nodes in the publisher configuration. Further information is provided in the OPC Publisher documentation.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The request contains the parts of the configuration to remove.

200.description: The operation was successful.

patch.description: Add or update endpoint configuration and nodes on a server. Further information is provided in the OPC Publisher documentation.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The parts of the configuration to add or update.

200.description: The operation was successful.

get.description: Get a list of nodes under a configured endpoint in the configuration. Further information is provided in the OPC Publisher documentation. configuration.

parameters.name: IncludeNodes
parameters.description: Include nodes that make up the configuration

200.description: The data was retrieved.

put.description: Enables clients to update the entire published nodes configuration in one call. This includes clearing the existing configuration. Further information is provided in the OPC Publisher documentation. configuration.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The new published nodes configuration

200.description: The operation was successful.

post.description: Get the nodes of a published nodes entry object returned earlier from a call to GetConfiguredEndpoints. Further information is provided in the OPC Publisher documentation.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The entry model from a call to GetConfiguredEndpoints for which to gather the nodes.

200.description: The information was returned.

post.description: Get the list of diagnostics info for all dataset writers in the OPC Publisher at the point the call is received. Further information is provided in the OPC Publisher documentation.

200.description: The operation was successful.

get.description: Can be used to reset all established connections causing a full reconnect and recreate of all subscriptions.

200.description: The operation was successful.

get.description: Can be used to set trace mode for all established connections. Call within a minute to keep trace mode up or else trace mode will be disabled again after 1 minute. Enabling and resetting tracemode will cause a reconnect of the client.

200.description: The operation was successful.

post.description: Find servers matching the specified endpoint query spec.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The endpoint query specifying the matching criteria for the discovered endpoints.

200.description:
The operation was successful or the response payload
            contains relevant error information.

post.description: Start server registration. The results of the registration are published as events to the default event transport.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Contains all information to perform the registration request including discovery url to use.

200.description:
The operation was successful or the response payload
            contains relevant error information.

post.description: Start network discovery using the provided discovery request configuration. The discovery results are published to the configured default event transport.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The discovery configuration to use during the discovery run.

200.description:
The operation was successful or the response payload
            contains relevant error information.

post.description: Cancel a discovery run that is ongoing using the discovery request token specified in the discover operation.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The information needed to cancel the discovery operation.

200.description:
The operation was successful or the response payload
            contains relevant error information.

post.description: Get the capabilities of the server. The server capabilities are exposed as a property of the server object and this method provides a convinient way to retrieve them.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The request payload and connection information identifying the server to connect to perform the operation on.

200.description:
The operation was successful or the response payload
            contains relevant error information.

post.description: Browse a a node to discover its references. For more information consult the relevant section of the OPC UA reference specification. The operation might return a continuation token. The continuation token can be used in the BrowseNext method call to retrieve the remainder of references or additional continuation tokens.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The request payload and connection information identifying the server to connect to perform the operation on.

200.description:
The operation was successful or the response payload
            contains relevant error information.

post.description: Browse next

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The request payload and connection information identifying the server to connect to perform the operation on.

200.description:
The operation was successful or the response payload
            contains relevant error information.

post.description: Recursively browse a node to discover its references and nodes. The results are returned as a stream of nodes and references. Consult the relevant section of the OPC UA reference specification for more information.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The request payload and connection information identifying the server to connect to perform the operation on.

200.description:
The operation was successful or the response payload

post.description: Translate a start node and browse path into 0 or more target nodes. Allows programming aginst types in OPC UA. For more information consult the relevant section of the OPC UA reference specification.

parameters.description: The request payload and connection information identifying the server to connect to perform the operation on.

post.description: Get the type metadata for a any node. For data type nodes the response contains the data type metadata including fields. For method nodes the output and input arguments metadata is provided. For objects and object types the instance declaration is returned.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The request payload and connection information identifying the server to connect to perform the operation on.

200.description:
The operation was successful or the response payload
            contains relevant error information.

parameters.description: The request payload and connection information identifying the server to connect to perform the operation on.

The operation was successful or the response payload

put.description: Create a published nodes entry for a specific writer group and dataset writer. The entry must specify a unique writer group and dataset writer id. A null value is treated as empty string. If the entry is found it is updated, if it is not found, it is created. If more than one entry is found with the same writer group and writer id an error is returned. The writer entry provided must include at least one node which will be the initial set. All nodes must specify a unique dataSetFieldId. A null value is treated as empty string. Publishing intervals at node level are also not supported and generate an error. Publishing intervals must be configured at the data set writer level.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The entry to create for the writer

200.description: The item was created

get.description: Get the published nodes entry for a specific writer group and dataset writer. Dedicated errors are returned if no, or no unique entry could be found. The entry does not contain the nodes. Nodes can be retrieved using the GetNodes API.

parameters.name: dataSetWriterGroup
parameters.description: The writer group name of the entry

parameters.name: dataSetWriterId
parameters.description: The data set writer identifer of the entry

200.description: The item was found

put.description: Add a node to a dedicated data set writer in a writer group. A node must have a unique DataSetFieldId. If the field already exists, the node is updated. If a node does not have a dataset field id an error is returned. Publishing intervals at node level are also not supported and generate an error. Publishing intervals must be configured at the data set writer level.

parameters.name: dataSetWriterGroup
parameters.description: The writer group name of the entry

parameters.name: dataSetWriterId
parameters.description: The data set writer identifer of the entry

parameters.name: insertAfterFieldId
parameters.description: Field after which to insert the nodes. If not specified, nodes are added at the end of the entry

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Node to add or update

200.description: The item was added

delete.description: Remove the published nodes entry for a specific data set writer in a writer group. Dedicated errors are returned if no, or no unique entry could be found.

parameters.name: dataSetWriterGroup
parameters.description: The writer group name of the entry

parameters.name: dataSetWriterId
parameters.description: The data set writer identifer of the entry

200.description: The entry was removed

post.description: Add Nodes to a dedicated data set writer in a writer group. Each node must have a unique DataSetFieldId. If the field already exists, the node is updated. If a node does not have a dataset field id an error is returned. Publishing intervals at node level are also not supported and generate an error. Publishing intervals must be configured at the data set writer level.

parameters.name: dataSetWriterGroup
parameters.description: The writer group name of the entry

parameters.name: dataSetWriterId
parameters.description: The data set writer identifer of the entry

parameters.name: insertAfterFieldId
parameters.description: Field after which to insert the nodes. If not specified, nodes are added at the end of the entry

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Nodes to add or update

200.description: The items were added

post.description: Remove Nodes that match the provided data set field ids from a data set writer in a writer group. If one of the fields is not found, no error is returned, however, if all fields are not found an error is returned.

parameters.name: dataSetWriterGroup
parameters.description: The writer group name of the entry

parameters.name: dataSetWriterId
parameters.description: The data set writer identifer of the entry

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The identifiers of the fields to remove

200.description: Some or all items were removed

delete.description: Remove a node with the specified data set field id from a data set writer in a writer group. If the field is not found, an error is returned.

parameters.name: dataSetWriterGroup
parameters.description: The writer group name of the entry

parameters.name: dataSetWriterId
parameters.description: The data set writer identifer of the entry

parameters.name: dataSetFieldId
parameters.description: Identifier of the field to remove

200.description: The item was removed

get.description: Get a node from a dataset in a writer group. Dedicated errors are returned if no, or no unique entry could be found, or the node does not exist.

parameters.name: dataSetWriterGroup
parameters.description: The writer group name of the entry

parameters.name: dataSetWriterId
parameters.description: The data set writer identifer of the entry

parameters.name: dataSetFieldId
parameters.description: The data set field id of the node to return

200.description: The item was retrieved

get.description: Get Nodes from a data set writer in a writer group. The nodes can optionally be offset from a previous last node identified by the dataSetFieldId and pageanated by the pageSize. If the dataSetFieldId is not found, an empty list is returned. If the dataSetFieldId is not specified, the first page is returned.

parameters.name: dataSetWriterGroup
parameters.description: The writer group name of the entry

parameters.name: dataSetWriterId
parameters.description: The data set writer identifer of the entry

parameters.name: lastDataSetFieldId
parameters.description: the field id after which to start the page. If not specified, nodes from the beginning are returned.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of nodes to return

200.description: The items were found

AdditionalData.description:
Flags that are set by the historian when
returning archived values.

treatUncertainAsBad.description: Whether to treat uncertain as bad

percentDataBad.description: Percent of data that is bad

percentDataGood.description: Percent of data that is good

locale.description: Locale of default name - defaults to "en"

localizedNames.description: Localized Names of application keyed on locale

capabilities.description: The capabilities advertised by the server.

hostAddresses.description: Host addresses of server application or null

notSeenSince.description: Last time application was seen if not visible

ApplicationRegistrationModel.description: Application with optional list of endpoints

nodeId.description: Node to read from or write to (mandatory)

AttributeWriteRequestModel.description: Attribute and value to write to it

securityPolicy.description: Security policy to use when passing credential.

nodeId.description:
Node to browse.
(defaults to root folder).

noSubtypes.description:
Whether to include subtypes of the reference type.
(default is false)

maxReferencesToReturn.description:
Max number of references to return. There might
be less returned as this is up to the client
restrictions.  Set to 0 to return no references
or target nodes.
(default is decided by client e.g. 60)

targetNodesOnly.description:
Whether to collapse all references into a set of
unique target nodes and not show reference
information.
(default is false)

readVariableValues.description:
Whether to read variable values on target nodes.
(default is false)

nodeClassFilter.description:
Filter returned target nodes by only returning
nodes that have classes defined in this array.
(default: null - all targets are returned)

nodeIdsOnly.description:
Whether to only return the raw node id
information and not read the target node.
(default is false)

BrowseFirstRequestModelRequestEnvelope.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

continuationToken.description: Continuation token if more results pending.

Continuation token from previews browse request.
(mandatory)

abort.description:
Whether to abort browse and release.
(default: false)

targetNodesOnly.description:
Whether to collapse all references into a set of
unique target nodes and not show reference
information.
(default is false)

readVariableValues.description:
Whether to read variable values on target nodes.
(default is false)

nodeIdsOnly.description:
Whether to only return the raw node id
information and not read the target node.
(default is false)

BrowseNextRequestModelRequestEnvelope.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

continuationToken.description: Continuation token if more results pending.

nodeId.description:
Node to browse from.
(defaults to root folder).

browsePaths.description:
The paths to browse from node.
(mandatory)

readVariableValues.description:
Whether to read variable values on target nodes.
(default is false)

nodeIdsOnly.description:
Whether to only return the raw node id
information and not read the target node.
(default is false)

BrowsePathRequestModelRequestEnvelope.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

nodeId.description:
Start nodes to browse.
(defaults to root folder).

noSubtypes.description:
Whether to include subtypes of the reference type.
(default is false)

readVariableValues.description:
Whether to read variable values on source nodes.
(default is false)

noRecurse.description:
Whether to not browse recursively
(default is false)

nodeClassFilter.description:
Filter returned target nodes by only returning
nodes that have classes defined in this array.
(default: null - all targets are returned)

BrowseStreamRequestModelRequestEnvelope.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

viewId.description: Node of the view to browse

version.description: Browses specific version of the view.

timestamp.description: Browses at or before this timestamp.

updateInterval.description: Time interval for sending pending interval updates in seconds.

snapshotInterval.description: Time interval for sending pending interval snapshot in seconds.

group.description:
Connection group allows splitting connections
per purpose.

locales.description: Optional list of preferred locales in preference order.

ConnectionOptions.description: Options that can be applied to a connection

ContentFilterElementModel.description: An expression element in the filter ast

filterOperands.description: The operands in the element for the operator

elements.description: The flat list of elements in the filter AST

CredentialModel.description:
Credential model. For backwards compatibility
the actual credentials to pass to the server is set
through the value property.

CredentialType.description: Type of credentials to use for authentication

dataType.description: The data type for the instance declaration.

browsePath.description:
An optional path from NodeId instance to
the actual node.

Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

DiagnosticsLevel.description: Level of diagnostics requested in responses

auditId.description:
Client audit log entry.
(default: client generated)

addressRangesToScan.description: Address ranges to scan (null == all wired nics)

maxNetworkProbes.description: Max network probes that should ever run.

portRangesToScan.description: Port ranges to scan (null == all unassigned)

maxPortProbes.description: Max port probes that should ever run.

minPortProbesPercent.description: Probes that must always be there as percent of max.

discoveryUrls.description: List of preset discovery urls to use

locales.description: List of locales to filter with during discovery

url.description: Endpoint url to use to connect with

alternativeUrls.description:
Alternative endpoint urls that can be used for
accessing and validating the server

securityPolicy.description:
Security policy uri to use for communication.
default to best.

id.description:
Endpoint identifier which is hashed from
the supervisor, site and url.

endpointUrl.description: Original endpoint url of the endpoint

discovererId.description: Entity that registered and can access the endpoint

authenticationMethods.description:
Supported authentication methods that can be selected to
obtain a credential and used to interact with the endpoint.

typeDefinitionId.description: Simple event Type definition node id

index.description:
Element reference in the outer list if
operand is an element operand

value.description: Variant value if operand is a literal

nodeId.description:
Type definition node id if operand is
simple or full attribute operand.

alias.description:
Optional alias to refer to it makeing it a
full blown attribute operand

dataType.description: Data type if operand is a literal

endpoints.description: Collection of Endpoints in the configuration

opcNodes.description: Collection of Nodes configured for a particular endpoint

eventFields.description: The selected fields of the event

items.description: A variant which can be represented by any value including null.

history.description: History as json encoded extension object

continuationToken.description: Continuation token if more results pending.

history.description: History as json encoded extension object

continuationToken.description: Continuation token if more results pending.

dataType.description: Built in data type of the updated values

sourceTimestamp.description: The source timestamp associated with the value.

sourcePicoseconds.description: Additional resolution for the source timestamp.

serverTimestamp.description: The server timestamp associated with the value.

serverPicoseconds.description: Additional resolution for the server timestamp.

history.description: History as json encoded extension object

continuationToken.description: Continuation token if more results pending.

history.description: History as json encoded extension object

continuationToken.description: Continuation token if more results pending.

stepped.description:
specifies whether the historical data was
collected in such a manner that it should
be displayed as SlopedInterpolation (sloped
line between points) or as SteppedInterpolation
(vertically-connected horizontal lines
between points) when raw data is examined.
This Property also effects how some
Aggregates are calculated

definition.description:
Human readable string that specifies how
the value of this HistoricalDataNode is
calculated

maxTimeInterval.description:
Specifies the maximum interval between data
points in the history repository
regardless of their value change

minTimeInterval.description:
Specifies the minimum interval between
data points in the history repository
regardless of their value change

exceptionDeviation.description:
Minimum amount that the data for the
Node shall change in order for the change
to be reported to the history database

startOfArchive.description:
The date before which there is no data in the
archive either online or offline

endOfArchive.description: The last date of the archive

startOfOnlineArchive.description: Date of the earliest data in the online archive

serverTimestampSupported.description:
Server supports ServerTimestamps in addition
to SourceTimestamp

nodeId.description:
Continuation token to continue reading more
results.

HistoryConfigurationRequestModelRequestE.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

continuationToken.description:
Continuation token to continue reading more
results.

HistoryReadNextRequestModelRequestEnvelo.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

maxReturnDataValues.description:
Maximum number of historic data values that will
be returned in a single read.

maxReturnEventValues.description:
Maximum number of events that will be returned
in a single read.

deleteAtTimeCapability.description: Server support deleting data at times

serverTimestampSupported.description:
Server supports ServerTimestamps in addition
to SourceTimestamp

results.description: List of results from the update operation

rootTypeId.description: The type that the declaration belongs to.

displayPath.description: A localized path to the instance declaration.

modellingRule.description:
The modelling rule for the instance
declaration (i.e. Mandatory or Optional).

nodeId.description: The node id for the instance.

browseName.description: The browse name for the instance declaration.

displayName.description: The display name for the instance declaration.

description.description: The description for the instance declaration.

value.description: Initial value or value to use

dataType.description: Data type Id of the value (from meta data)

methodId.description: Method id of method to call.

objectId.description:
Context of the method, i.e. an object or object type
node.  If null then the method is called in the context
of the inverse HasComponent reference of the MethodId
if it exists.

arguments.description: Arguments for the method - null means no args

methodBrowsePath.description:
An optional component path from the node identified by
MethodId or from a resolved objectId to the actual
method node.

objectBrowsePath.description:
An optional component path from the node identified by
ObjectId to the actual object or objectType node.
If ObjectId is null, the root node (i=84) is used

MethodCallRequestModelRequestEnvelope.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

results.description: Resulting output values of method call

objectId.description: Id of object that the method is a component of

methodId.description:
Method id of method to call.
(Required)

methodBrowsePath.description:
An optional component path from the node identified by
MethodId to the actual method node.

MethodMetadataRequestModelRequestEnvelop.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

objectId.description: Id of object that the method is a component of

ModelChangeHandlingOptionsModel.description: Describes how model changes are published

NamespaceFormat.description:
Namespace serialization format for node ids
and qualified names.

NodeAccessLevel.description: Flags that can be set for the AccessLevel attribute.

NodeAccessRestrictions.description:
Flags that can be read or written in the
AccessRestrictions attribute.

NodeEventNotifier.description: Flags that can be set for the EventNotifier attribute.

browsePath.description:
An optional component path from the node identified by
NodeId to the actual node.

NodeMetadataRequestModelRequestEnvelope.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

nodeId.description: The node id of the node

displayName.description: The display name of the node.

value.description:
Value of variable or default value of the
subtyped variable in case node is a variable
type, otherwise null.

sourcePicoseconds.description: Pico seconds part of when value was read at source.

sourceTimestamp.description: Timestamp of when value was read at source.

serverPicoseconds.description: Pico seconds part of when value was read at server.

serverTimestamp.description: Timestamp of when value was read at server.

writeMask.description:
Default write mask for the node
(default: 0)

userWriteMask.description:
User write mask for the node
(default: 0)

isAbstract.description:
Whether type is abstract, if type can
be abstract.  Null if not type node.
(default: false)

containsNoLoops.description:
Whether a view contains loops. Null if
not a view.

executable.description:
If method node class, whether method can
be called.

userExecutable.description:
If method node class, whether method can
be called by current user.
(default: false if not executable)

dataTypeDefinition.description:
Data type definition in case node is a
data type node and definition is available,
otherwise null.

dataType.description:
If variable the datatype of the variable.
(default: null)

arrayDimensions.description:
Array dimensions of variable or variable type.
(default: empty array)

historizing.description:
Whether the value of a variable is historizing.
(default: false)

minimumSamplingInterval.description:
Minimum sampling interval for the variable
value, otherwise null if not a variable node.
(default: null)

inverseName.description:
Inverse name of the reference if the node is
a reference type, otherwise null.

symmetric.description:
Whether the reference is symmetric in case
the node is a reference type, otherwise
null.

typeDefinitionId.description: Optional type definition of the node

children.description:
Whether node has children which are defined as
any forward hierarchical references.
(default: unknown)

NodeValueRank.description: Constants defined for the ValueRank attribute.

OpcAuthenticationMode.description: Enum that defines the authentication method

OpcNodeModel.description: Describing an entry in the node list

DataSetFieldId.description:
The identifier of the field in the dataset message.
If not provided Azure.IIoT.OpcUa.Publisher.Models.OpcNodeModel.DisplayName is used.

DataSetClassFieldId.description:
The identifier of the field in the dataset class.
Allows correlation to the data set class.

QueueSize.description:
Queue Size for the monitored item on the server.
Specifies how many values are queued on the server
before undelivered ones are discarded.

DiscardNew.description:
Discard new values in the server queue instead of
old values when no more room in queue.

DeadbandValue.description:
Deadband value of the data change filter to apply.
Does not apply to events

BrowsePath.description:
Browse path from the node to reach the actual node
to monitor.

IndexRange.description: Index range to read, default to null.

Topic.description:
Topic to publish to - splits network messages
along the lines of topic name and overrides
the queue name of the writer and writer group.

SkipFirst.description:
Do not send the first value that is always provided
by the server when the monitored item is created.

RegisterNode.description: Register node for reading before sampling.

FetchDisplayName.description: Fetch display name from the node

TriggeredNodes.description:
Nodes that are triggered by the parent node.
Nodes cannot themselves trigger other nodes, any
such setting is silently discarded. Triggered nodes
can only be updated as an atomic unit using API.

maxNodesPerBrowse.description: Max nodes that can be part of a single browse call.

maxNodesPerRead.description: Max nodes that can be read in single read call

maxNodesPerWrite.description: Max nodes that can be read in single write call

maxNodesPerMethodCall.description: Max nodes that can be read in single method call

maxNodesPerHistoryReadData.description: Number of nodes that can be in a History Read value call

maxNodesPerHistoryReadEvents.description: Number of nodes that can be in a History Read events call

maxNodesPerHistoryUpdateData.description: Number of nodes that can be in a History Update call

maxNodesPerHistoryUpdateEvents.description: Number of nodes that can be in a History events update call

maxNodesPerRegisterNodes.description: Max nodes that can be registered at once

maxNodesPerTranslatePathsToNodeIds.description: Max nodes that can be part of a browse path

maxNodesPerNodeManagement.description: Max nodes that can be added or removed in a single call.

maxMonitoredItemsPerCall.description: Max monitored items that can be updated at once.

PublishBulkRequestModelRequestEnvelope.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

endpoints.description:
Endpoints covered by the diagnostics model.
The endpoints are all part of the same writer
group. Specify

ingressDataChangesInLastMinute.description: Data changes received in the last minute

ingressValueChangesInLastMinute.description: Value changes received in the last minute

ingressHeartbeats.description: Number of heartbeats of the total value changes

ingressCyclicReads.description: Number of cyclic reads of the total value changes

PublishStartRequestModelRequestEnvelope.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

nodeId.description: Node of published item to unpublish

PublishStopRequestModelRequestEnvelope.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

continuationToken.description: Continuation token or null to start

PublishedItemListRequestModelRequestEnve.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

displayName.description: Display name of the variable node monitored

PublishedNodesEntryModel.description: Contains the nodes which should be published

DataSetWriterId.description: Name of the data set writer.

DataSetWriterGroup.description: The Group the writer belongs to.

DataSetName.description: The optional short name of the dataset.

DataSetPublishingInterval.description:
The Publishing interval for a dataset writer
in miliseconds.

DataSetPublishingIntervalTimespan.description:
The Publishing interval for a dataset writer
in timespan format. Takes precedence over
Azure.IIoT.OpcUa.Publisher.Models.PublishedNodesEntryModel.DataSetPublishingInterval if defined.

DataSetKeyFrameCount.description: Insert a key frame every x messages

MetaDataUpdateTime.description:
Send metadata at the configured interval
even when not changing expressed in milliseconds.

MetaDataUpdateTimeTimespan.description:
Send metadata at the configured interval even when not
changing expressed as duration. Takes precedence over
Azure.IIoT.OpcUa.Publisher.Models.PublishedNodesEntryModel.MetaDataUpdateTimeif defined.

SendKeepAliveDataSetMessages.description:
Send a keep alive message when a subscription keep
alive notification is received inside the writer. If keep
alive messages are not supported by the messaging
profile chosen this value is ignored.

EndpointUrl.description: The endpoint URL of the OPC UA server.

MaxKeepAliveCount.description:
When the publishing timer has expired this number of
times without requiring any Notification to be sent,
to the writer a keep-alive message is sent.

DataSetDescription.description: The optional description of the dataset.

DataSetExtensionFields.description:
Optional field and value pairs to insert into the
data sets emitted by data set writer.

additionalProperties.description: A variant which can be represented by any value including null.

EndpointSecurityPolicy.description:
The specific security policy to use for the specified
endpoint. Overrides Azure.IIoT.OpcUa.Publisher.Models.PublishedNodesEntryModel.UseSecurity setting.
If the security policy is not available with the
specified security mode connectivity will fail.

BatchSize.description:
Send network messages when the notification queue
exceeds this number. Causes this many notifications
to be added to network messages

BatchTriggerInterval.description:
Send network messages at the specified publishing
interval.

BatchTriggerIntervalTimespan.description:
Send network messages at the specified publishing
interval.
Takes precedence over Azure.IIoT.OpcUa.Publisher.Models.PublishedNodesEntryModel.BatchTriggerInterval
if defined.

UseReverseConnect.description: Use reverse connect to connect ot the endpoint

WriterGroupQueueName.description:
Writer group queue overrides the default writer group
topic template to use.

UseSecurity.description:
Secure transport should be used to connect to
the opc server.

QueueName.description:
Writer queue overrides the writer group queue name.
Network messages are then split across queues with
Qos also accounted for.

MetaDataQueueName.description:
Meta data queue name to use for the writer. Overrides
the default metadata topic template.

WriterGroupPartitions.description:
Number of partitions to split the writer group into
when publishing to target topics.

republishAfterTransfer.description:
Republish after transferring the subscription during
reconnect handling unless subscription transfer was disabled.

OpcNodeWatchdogTimespan.description:
The timeout to use to monitor the monitored items in the
subscription are continously reporting fresh data.

DataSetSamplingInterval.description:
The default sampling interval for all items in a dataset writer
in miliseconds if the nodes do not specify a sampling rate.

DataSetSamplingIntervalTimespan.description:
The Sampling interval for the nodes in the dataset writer
in timespan format. Takes precedence over
Azure.IIoT.OpcUa.Publisher.Models.PublishedNodesEntryModel.DataSetSamplingInterval if defined.

DataSetFetchDisplayNames.description:
Whether to fetch the display name and use it as
data set id for all opc node items in the data set

Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

browsePath.description:
An optional path from NodeId instance to
the actual node.

indexRange.description:
Index range to read, e.g. 1:2,0:1 for 2 slices
out of a matrix or 0:1 for the first item in
an array, string or bytestring.
See 7.22 of part 4: NumericRange.

Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

startTime.description: The start time to read from

endTime.description: The end time to read to

numValues.description: The number of values to read

An optional path from NodeId instance to
the actual node.

indexRange.description:
Index range to read, e.g. 1:2,0:1 for 2 slices
out of a matrix or 0:1 for the first item in
an array, string or bytestring.
See 7.22 of part 4: NumericRange.

Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

aggregateType.description:
The aggregate type to apply. Can be the name of
the aggregate if available in the history server
capabilities, or otherwise will be used as a node
id referring to the aggregate.

browsePath.description:
An optional path from NodeId instance to
the actual node.

indexRange.description:
Index range to read, e.g. 1:2,0:1 for 2 slices
out of a matrix or 0:1 for the first item in
an array, string or bytestring.
See 7.22 of part 4: NumericRange.

Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

ReadRequestModelRequestEnvelope.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

browsePath.description:
An optional path from NodeId instance to
the actual node.

indexRange.description:
Index range to read, e.g. 1:2,0:1 for 2 slices
out of a matrix or 0:1 for the first item in
an array, string or bytestring.
See 7.22 of part 4: NumericRange.

ReadValuesAtTimesDetailsModelHistoryRead.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

startTime.description:
Beginning of period to read. Set to null
if no specific start time is specified.

endTime.description:
End of period to read. Set to null if no
specific end time is specified.

numValues.description:
The maximum number of values returned for any Node
over the time range. If only one time is specified,
the time range shall extend to return this number
of values. 0 or null indicates that there is no
maximum.

returnBounds.description: Whether to return the bounding values or not.

browsePath.description:
An optional path from NodeId instance to
the actual node.

indexRange.description:
Index range to read, e.g. 1:2,0:1 for 2 slices
out of a matrix or 0:1 for the first item in
an array, string or bytestring.
See 7.22 of part 4: NumericRange.

ReadValuesDetailsModelHistoryReadRequest.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

locales.description:
Optional list of preferred locales in preference
order to be used during connecting the session.
We suggest to use the connection object to set
the locales

operationTimeout.description:
Operation timeout in ms. This applies to every
operation that is invoked, not to the entire
transaction and overrides the configured operation
timeout.

serviceCallTimeout.description:
Service call timeout in ms. As opposed to the
operation timeout this terminates the entire
transaction if it takes longer than the timeout to
complete. Note that a connect and reconnect during
the service call is gated by the connect timeout
setting. If a connect timeout is not specified
this timeout is used also for connect timeout.

connectTimeout.description:
Connect timeout in ms. As opposed to the service call
timeout this terminates the entire transaction if
it takes longer than the timeout to connect a session
A connect and reconnect during the service call
resets the timeout therefore the overall time for
the call to complete can be longer than specified.

RequestHeaderModelRequestEnvelope.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

RolePermissions.description: Individual permissions assigned to a role

discoveryUrl.description: Discovery url to use to query

url.description: Endpoint url that should match the found endpoint

securityPolicy.description: Endpoint must support this Security policy.

certificate.description: Endpoint must match with this certificate thumbprint

discoveryUrl.description: Discovery url to use for registration

statusCode.description: Error code - if null operation succeeded.

errorMessage.description: Error message in case of error or null.

endpoints.description: Endpoints and nodes that make up the configuration

typeDefinitionId.description:
Type definition node id if operand is
simple or full attribute operand.

dataSetClassFieldId.description: Optional data set class field id (Publisher extension)

TestConnectionRequestModelRequestEnvelop.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

typeDefinitionId.description: The node id of the type of the node

typeHierarchy.description:
Super types hierarchy starting from base type
up to Azure.IIoT.OpcUa.Publisher.Models.TypeDefinitionModel.TypeDefinitionId which is
not included.

typeMembers.description:
Fully inherited instance declarations of the type
of the node.

UpdateEventsDetailsModel.description: Insert, upsert or replace historic events

browsePath.description:
An optional path from NodeId instance to
the actual node.

UpdateEventsDetailsModelHistoryUpdateReq.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

UpdateValuesDetailsModel.description: Insert, upsert, or update historic values

browsePath.description:
An optional path from NodeId instance to
the actual node.

UpdateValuesDetailsModelHistoryUpdateReq.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

user.description:
For Azure.IIoT.OpcUa.Publisher.Models.CredentialType.UserName authentication
            this is the name of the user.
            


            For Azure.IIoT.OpcUa.Publisher.Models.CredentialType.X509Certificate authentication
            this is the subject name of the certificate that has been
            configured.
            Either Azure.IIoT.OpcUa.Publisher.Models.UserIdentityModel.User or Azure.IIoT.OpcUa.Publisher.Models.UserIdentityModel.Thumbprint must be
            used to select the certificate in the user certificate store.
            


            Not used for the other authentication types.

password.description:
For Azure.IIoT.OpcUa.Publisher.Models.CredentialType.UserName authentication
            this is the password of the user.
            


            For Azure.IIoT.OpcUa.Publisher.Models.CredentialType.X509Certificate authentication
            this is the passcode to export the configured certificate's
            private key.
            


            Not used for the other authentication types.

thumbprint.description:
For Azure.IIoT.OpcUa.Publisher.Models.CredentialType.X509Certificate authentication
            this is the thumbprint of the configured certificate to use.
            Either Azure.IIoT.OpcUa.Publisher.Models.UserIdentityModel.User or Azure.IIoT.OpcUa.Publisher.Models.UserIdentityModel.Thumbprint must be
            used to select the certificate in the user certificate store.
            


            Not used for the other authentication types.

browsePath.description:
An optional path from NodeId instance to
an actual node.

indexRange.description:
Index range to read, e.g. 1:2,0:1 for 2 slices
out of a matrix or 0:1 for the first item in
an array, string or bytestring.
See 7.22 of part 4: NumericRange.

maxAge.description:
Maximum age of the value to be read in milliseconds.
The age of the value is based on the difference
between the ServerTimestamp and the time when
the Server starts processing the request.
If not supplied, the Server shall attempt to read
a new value from the data source.

ValueReadRequestModelRequestEnvelope.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

dataType.description: Built in data type of the value read.

sourcePicoseconds.description: Pico seconds part of when value was read at source.

sourceTimestamp.description: Timestamp of when value was read at source.

serverPicoseconds.description: Pico seconds part of when value was read at server.

serverTimestamp.description: Timestamp of when value was read at server.

nodeId.description: Node id to write value to.

browsePath.description:
An optional path from NodeId instance to
the actual node.

value.description:
Value to write. The system tries to convert
the value according to the data type value,
e.g. convert comma seperated value strings
into arrays.  (Mandatory)

dataType.description:
A built in datatype for the value. This can
be a data type from browse, or a built in
type.
(default: best effort)

ValueWriteRequestModelRequestEnvelope.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

history.description: History as json encoded extension object

continuationToken.description: Continuation token if more results pending.

browsePath.description:
An optional path from NodeId instance to
the actual node.

details.description:
The HistoryReadDetailsType extension object
encoded in json and containing the tunneled
Historian reader request.

indexRange.description:
Index range to read, e.g. 1:2,0:1 for 2 slices
out of a matrix or 0:1 for the first item in
an array, string or bytestring.
See 7.22 of part 4: NumericRange.

VariantValueHistoryReadRequestModelReque.description:
Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

history.description: History as json encoded extension object

continuationToken.description: Continuation token if more results pending.

browsePath.description:
An optional path from NodeId instance to
the actual node.

details.description:
The HistoryUpdateDetailsType extension object
encoded as json Variant and containing the tunneled
update request for the Historian server. The value
is updated at edge using above node address.

Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a
body more easily for api that requires a
connection endpoint

Wraps a request and a connection to bind to a

tags.name: Certificates
tags.description:
This section lists the certificate APi provided by OPC Publisher providing
            all public and private key infrastructure (PKI) related API methods.
            


            The method name for all transports other than HTTP (which uses the shown
            HTTP methods and resource uris) is the name of the subsection header.
            To use the version specific method append "_V1" or "_V2" to the method
            name.

tags.name: Configuration
tags.description:
This section contains the API to configure OPC Publisher.
            


            The method name for all transports other than HTTP (which uses the shown
            HTTP methods and resource uris) is the name of the subsection header.
            To use the version specific method append "_V1" or "_V2" to the method
            name.

tags.name: Diagnostics
tags.description:
This section lists the diagnostics APi provided by OPC Publisher providing
            connection related diagnostics API methods.
            


            The method name for all transports other than HTTP (which uses the shown
            HTTP methods and resource uris) is the name of the subsection header.
            To use the version specific method append "_V1" or "_V2" to the method
            name.

tags.name: Discovery
tags.description:
OPC UA and network discovery related API.


            The method name for all transports other than HTTP (which uses the shown
            HTTP methods and resource uris) is the name of the subsection header.
            To use the version specific method append "_V1" or "_V2" to the method

tags.name: General
tags.description:
This section lists the general APi provided by OPC Publisher providing
            all connection, endpoint and address space related API methods.
            


            The method name for all transports other than HTTP (which uses the shown
            HTTP methods and resource uris) is the name of the subsection header.
            To use the version specific method append "_V1" or "_V2" to the method
            name.

tags.name: History
tags.description:
This section lists all OPC UA HDA or Historian related API provided by
            OPC Publisher.
            


            The method name for all transports other than HTTP (which uses the shown
            HTTP methods and resource uris) is the name of the subsection header.
            To use the version specific method append "_V1" or "_V2" to the method
            name.

tags.name: Writer
tags.description:
This section contains the API to configure data set writers and writer
            groups inside OPC Publisher. It supersedes the configuration API.
            Applications should use one or the other, but not both at the same
            time.
            


            The method name for all transports other than HTTP (which uses the shown
            HTTP methods and resource uris) is the name of the subsection header.
            To use the version specific method append "_V1" or "_V2" to the method
            name.
